text: Radim Uzel (27 March 1940 â€“ 2 May 2022) was a Czech sexologist and academic. He was director of the Society for Family Planning and Sexual Education. He was also an unsuccessful candidate to the Senate of the Czech Republic. He worked for Masaryk University. Uzel was born in Ostrava, Protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia. Uzel died on 2 May 2022 in Prague, Czech Republic from problems caused by stomach cancer on 2 May 2022, aged 82. ==References== Category:1940 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Czech politicians Category:Czech academics Category:Czech scientists Category:Czechoslovak academics
title: Radim Uzel
